scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of the team members, Alex, says, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time.' You suggested taking a short break and coming back with a fresh perspective. [Monica] agreed, but [Bob] still seems skeptical. After the break, [Bob] says, 'Even with a break, I don't see how we're going to manage this.'
scenes.description: [Monica] adds, 'Yeah, we need a better plan or more resources.'

options.text: I hear you both. Let's break down the tasks into smaller pieces and assign them based on everyone's strengths. That way, we can make progress step by step.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the team's concerns and proposed a practical solution, demonstrating empathy and good social skills.

options.text: I know it's tough, but if we all pull together and stay focused, we can make it happen. We can handle this, just like we've handled challenges before.
options.analysis: You encouraged the team to stay focused and work together, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills.

options.text: Let's take a step back and revisit our strategy. If needed, we can request additional resources or adjust our approach to make it more feasible.
options.analysis: You suggested taking a step back to reassess the situation and offered to seek additional resources, showing good emotional perception and self-regulation.
